item.title: The lights in Highland Road are in the trees. The branches of the tree outside 109 Highland Road is very low and an accident waiting to happen, 6th November
item.description:
Highland Road is quite dark to walk along at night. The some of the branches of the tree outside 109 Highland Road (I think) are dangerously low.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Madeira Avenue, Shortlands, London

item.title: All lights out on Marlborough Road, 6th November
item.description:
The photo probably doesn't show just how dangerously dark it is on Marlborough Road with ALL the street lights out of order. This is especially dangerous for cyclists and other vulnerable road users.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pall Mall, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More flytipping, 6th November

item.title: Opposite no. 16, 6th November
item.description:
The street light, column number 9, has not been working for some time. As light no 8, opposite house no. 20 is not working either, a long stretch of the road there remains unlit, creating a safety risk for pedestrians and residents. Please repair these two lights asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39,41,43,45,47,49, Lyndhurst Gardens, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Lamp post light is flickering brightly., 5th November
item.description:
The lamp has been flashing non stop for a month now. I thought it was an emergency service or road works but it's just looks like a dodgy light bulb. The whole street corner flashes at night. It must be a hazard for drivers too who could be falsely alarmed by the flashing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Lane, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
